Low level UART configuration.

Use only the next parameters if you want configure the UART.

Detailed Description

UART Communication.

The UART bus interface is a slow serial bus.

The POB-EYE2 comes with 2 UARTs interface, named UART0 and UART1:

  • UART0 is connected on the USB.
  • UART1 is free for use (used by default for the ZigBee/Wifi option).

Use the UART0 Interrupt
#include <pob-eye.h>

int main(void)
{
    UInt8 value;

    InitPobeye2();

    // Init the uart 0 and use the hardware interrupt routine:
    InitUART0Intr(115200);

    while(1)
    {
        if( GetByteFromUART0Intr(&value) == 1 )
        {
            // If a data is receveid from uart 0, then...

            // Send the received byte...
            SendByteToUART0(value);

        }
    }

    return 0;
}

UInt8 GetByteFromUART0 ( void   ) 

Get a byte from the UART0.

Don't use this function if you are using the UART Interrupt!

Returns:

UInt8 GetByteFromUART0Intr ( UInt8 *  Data  ) 

Get a byte from the UART0 Interrupt Buffer.

Parameters:
[out] Data Pointer to a byte where store the byte received.
Returns:

void InitUART0 ( UInt32  baudrate  ) 

Init UART0 (USB).

Parameters:
baudrate UART0 baudrate.

void InitUART0Intr ( UInt32  baudrate  ) 

Init UART0 (USB) with an interrupt on reception.

The UART0 reception use an hardware interrupt: No byte is lost during reception and you don't have to poll the UART.

Parameters:
baudrate UART0 baudrate.

Init UART1 with an interrupt on reception.
